If you're reading this, get ready for 6+ years of built up resentment.

This is a review coming from someone who played OW consistently from Summer Games 2016 up until the announcement of the PVE cancellation (yes, the PVE they promised was CANCELLED! The replacement they put in game was not what was promised at all). I was a Grandmaster player for more than half of the original games lifetime and even played on a team at that level, and also frequented the game at the lowest level on an alt account. I have more experience with the game than most other people. If you think that this negative review is just part of the """review bombing,""" you obviously had never played the original game and refuse to listen to people's legitimate criticisms.

With that being said: ***UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD YOU PURCHASE ANYTHING IN THIS GAME, LET ALONE PLAY IT AT ALL.***

The game's current state of being a microtransaction filled dumpsterfire being puppeted around as its predecessor, along with the constant lies and underdelivering from the development team should just show you how little Blizzard cares for this game anymore. From the very beginning, a solid and engaging PVE was what I wanted most out of the game. I played PVP to death and burnt out, but I still consider the original Overwatch to be my favorite PVP game ever made. If they had been able to deliver an equivalent experience in PVE, this review would be positive in spite of the multiple awful things surrounding PVP and Blizzard as a whole.

I'm someone who can deal with a lot of bullshit. Brig's release, GOATs, Role Lock (Definitely the worst update in terms of game enjoyment, even worse than Brig), and the three year content drought were not enough to dissuade me from playing the game because I could always feel the passion from the dev team behind the project. I still miss playing heroes like Reinhardt, Roadhog, and Junkrat, but I can no longer gaslight myself into supporting a product that so heinously prioritizes grabbing at your wallet over actual quality. 

They're only after your wallet, plain and simple. Blizzard failed to realize that short-term profit boosts from battlepasses and $20 skins completely screwed their games reputation and dwindled their player numbers. They're trying to build a multiplatform brand out of Overwatch, but it will fail because even their most diehard fans from the early years no longer care about the game. They should have prioritized keeping their players happy over their investors, as their long-term financial gains from multiplatforming would have been massive. 

On top of making OW2 and objective downgrade from the first, you cannot go back and play OW1 (which millions paid money for), which makes this stain on the game industry an even bigger kick to the dick. OW2 is the pinnacle of what gamers mean when they talk about why "modern gaming sucks." Abysmal predatory microtransactions, inconsistent at best "live service", tone deaf lead company and developers, and a lack of passion and direction. Their eyes were on the money and they choked out their golden goose. 

I'm surprised to see that at the time of writing, this game only has a 13% positive review on steam. It should definitely be lower. The Microsoft acquisition isn't going to save Overwatch, the dream is dead. If you still support this game (especially monetarily), please take a long look at many of the negative reviews and figure out why people don't like it instead of blindly acting as Blizzard's PR lapdog. If you aren't bothered by the issues people have, enjoy the game. But I can promise you that they will only disappoint you in the future with half-baked updates and illusions of a grand future.

20还是21年就接触过守望，不过当时是就是偶尔玩一下，有时候玩一下也玩不太懂，后面应该算是懂了一点之后，正好遇到20年疫情，回声上线，第一次主观地想去玩，第一次玩回声，复制死神五杀全场最佳，记得好清楚哈哈哈，然后就一发不可收拾
前前后后也算是玩了三四百小时吧，也不太好统计，我自己的号有三百左右应该，算是我玩过第二多的游戏一直很喜欢
不知道守望先锋归来还有没有像守望一那样的游戏体验，5v5也不知道有什么影响，应该没有多大，毕竟我不咋玩t，t玩得也最差，就是铁拳改动搞得我好难受（天国的上勾拳！），最喜欢玩的英雄就是铁拳了（可能吧，或许是），第二是麦克雷（今天就是天王老子来了他也叫麦克雷），第三是源氏，不过麦克雷最近不咋玩，狂鼠强度高一点，玩狂鼠玩得多，要不就是铁拳娱乐。
在过去的游戏里，我也不是没有过跟别人吵架，有时候花一个小时加好友和加小队就为了骂回去，不过大多数情况是对面骂完就退哈哈哈，我倒是没咋骂过人，反击就不少了，也没咋记清楚，队友摆过烂，也经历过那种队友摆烂输得难受还要玩的情况，但是还是一直有在玩
只要没什么意外，我还会偶尔打开ow2玩一玩
只要没什么意外，只要我的朋友们还在
再见，希望归来之时，能依然热爱如初

Watching only the vanguard did not return
When Watchdog Pioneer 1 disappeared, it was also the end of Watchdog IP. The company made this decision for its own benefit, thinking that it could find a new agent Forget it, when Blizzard made unreasonable demands on NetEase (China), Blizzard was already dead. At first, I thought it was just a prank, but in one event, it was written 'No Chinese Players'. This is a complete break. Now it is being launched on Steam again, starting with Simplified Chinese and then canceling mobile phone authentication This is really funny 'A cat that scratched you but wanted to go home with you' (Big_Rabbit). This time it will be completely eradicated.
Games are good, bringing many joyful moments and passions. But I made a mistake. The company kept watch and only the vanguard did not return

[h1]Every single update brings another disappointment.[/h1]

I put maybe 500 hours into Overwatch 1, then maybe 100 into Overwatch 2 within the first few months before realizing that the game was never going to recapture the original Overwatch. In almost every single way, the game has gotten worse and keeps doing so. 

PVE was canceled, so there's literally zero point for Overwatch 2 to be a sequel anymore. There's a hundred other reviews regaling how awful that is and I don't want to reiterate what they're saying, but in the shortest terms possible: Without PVE there is no reason for Overwatch 2 to exist at all. 

But my main issue with Overwatch 2 is the lack of polish present throughout things such as map design and hero balancing. Let me be clear that I in no way blame the devs themselves, I'm sure that it's all higher ups making terrible decisions for profit, because in certain areas there is clearly a lot of care. Things such as the artwork, worldbuilding, story, all of that is clearly cared for immensely. But those things can't save the game when the two most important aspects of it are not held to a high standard.

There's a gamemode called Push, which is essentially like Payload but both teams are pushing one objective between eachother. I didn't instantly leave matches of Push when they showed up, but I feel absolutely no contempt for people who did. Which I feel gives a good summation of how unfun the mode is. 

Hero balancing is just plain terrible and changes take several seasons to take place, if they ever even do. One hero, Sombra, I quite enjoyed. She was basically all I played, but she was quite annoying to fight and have on your team so Blizzard nerfed her into one of the worst heroes the game has ever seen. Quite a drastic solution, but I could see why they did it since her kit is very annoying and difficult to balance, and they said they would rework her into a less annoying hero to fight while providing more value to her team. We just gotta wait till season 3 for it! ...Then season 4 ...Then the mid season update in season 4 ...And now season 7. 

Such a shame. Overwatch 1 was one of the most fun games I'd ever played, and If anything I'm more impressed at how much Blizzard has managed to fumble it.
